byline.contributor: David E. Sanger and Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Washington, and Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER, JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and NICOLE PERLROTH

abstract: Office of Personnel Management warned in November 2014 of severe computer security vulnerabilities but Chinese cyberattack had already collected tens of thousands of sensitive files; officials say Chinese group that attacked office is likely same one that stole records from health care firms Anthem and Primera.
lead_paragraph: The same attackers who breached the records of millions of government workers appear to be behind similar thefts at Anthem and Premera Blue Cross, cybersecurity experts say.

headline.main: U.S. Was Warned of System Open to Cyberattacks
headline.print_headline: U.S. Was Warned of System Open to Cyberattacks

snippet: The same attackers who breached the records of millions of government workers appear to be behind similar thefts at Anthem and Premera Blue Cross, cybersecurity experts say.
